title: ATP Tour Masters 1000
summary: The ATP Masters tournaments (previously known as ATP Masters Series) is an annual series of nine tennis tournaments featuring the top-ranked players on the ATP Tour. The series' events have been held in Europe and North America since the debut of ATP Tour in 1990, and also in Asia since 2009. The ATP Masters, along with the ATP Finals, constitute the most coveted trophies in men's tennis after the four majors, and the tournaments are collectively known as the "Big Titles" (alongside the Olympics).[1]
